ai.summary: A versatile 8.1 km moderate hike on forest trails in the UK, with gentle climbs, occasional rocky stretches, and scenic views.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly woodland paths with some rocky sections and rooty ground. Elevation gain is moderate, with a few short ascents and descents; expect damp and muddy sections after rain. Navigation is straightforward on well-marked routes.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy boots with good grip; stay on marked paths; check the forecast and avoid the route in high wind or ice; bring water and snacks; tell someone your plan and expected return time; watch for slippery rocks, uneven footing, and changes in weather; allow extra time in low light conditions.
recommended_gear: Headlamp or flashlight (in case of late return)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) when trails are drier and views are clearer; in winter expect more mud and colder conditions.

seo.title: Cloughmore Trail – 8.1 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Cloughmore Trail, an 8.1 km moderate hike in the UK. Enjoy forest paths, rocky viewpoints, and varied terrain with practical safety and gear tips.
